metadata.name: Grammarly Browser Extension
metadata.description: Grammarly browser extension for writing assistance, grammar checking, and AI-powered text enhancement across web platforms

workflows.name: User Authentication & Authorization
steps: Initiate OAuth 2.0 flow with Grammarly services
Handle multi-environment authentication (production/preprod/QA)
Store authentication tokens securely
Establish cross-platform session synchronization
Validate user permissions and subscription tier

workflows.name: Text Processing & Checking
steps: Capture text input from various web platforms
Process text through CAPI for grammar/style analysis
Integrate with AI services (OpenAI, Claude) for enhanced suggestions
Display real-time suggestions and corrections
Track user acceptance/rejection of suggestions

workflows.name: Feature Experimentation & Configuration
steps: Retrieve current feature flags and experiment assignments
Apply feature configurations to extension behavior
Track feature usage and performance metrics
Report experiment results to analytics pipeline
Handle feature rollouts and rollbacks

workflows.name: Comprehensive Telemetry & Analytics
steps: Collect comprehensive user behavior data across 30+ event types
Aggregate frontend performance metrics and error reports
Transmit telemetry data to multiple analytics endpoints
Implement privacy-aware analytics with user consent
Generate business intelligence and usage reports

workflows.name: Subscription & Monetization
steps: Validate user subscription tier and permissions
Handle premium feature access control
Process upgrade flows and billing integrations
Sync subscription status across devices
Track feature usage for billing purposes

workflows.name: Cross-Platform Integration
steps: Inject specialized scripts for Google Workspace integration
Coordinate with Grammarly desktop application
Handle platform-specific text processing workflows
Manage cross-platform authentication and data sync
Adapt UI and functionality for different platforms

privacy.minimization: INSUFFICIENT - Extension collects extensive telemetry data beyond core functionality requirements, including detailed user behavior tracking and comprehensive analytics
privacy.consent: UNCLEAR - No explicit consent mechanism observed for comprehensive data collection, particularly for analytics and behavioral tracking beyond core writing assistance
privacy.retention: UNDEFINED - No clear data retention policies documented, with some data stored indefinitely and others with session-based retention

third_parties.name: OpenAI
third_parties.purpose: AI-powered writing assistance and ChatGPT integration

third_parties.name: Anthropic (Claude)
third_parties.purpose: AI writing assistance and content enhancement

third_parties.name: Google Services
third_parties.purpose: Authentication, document integration, and translation services

third_parties.name: Analytics Providers
third_parties.purpose: Usage analytics, performance monitoring, and business intelligence

privacy.policy_compliance: NON-COMPLIANT - Multiple GDPR violations including lack of explicit consent, excessive data collection, undefined retention policies, and potential special category data processing without adequate safeguards

risks.justification: Extension processes and transmits user-generated text content including potentially sensitive personal, professional, and educational information to remote servers without explicit user consent
Extension requests broad permissions including access to all URLs, cookies, tabs, and storage with capabilities that extend beyond core writing assistance functionality
Comprehensive user behavior tracking across 30+ telemetry channels capturing detailed analytics including typing patterns, feature usage, and cross-platform activity
Local storage of sensitive data including OAuth tokens, user content cache, and authentication credentials without evidence of encryption at rest
Multiple privacy policy violations including GDPR non-compliance, lack of explicit consent for data processing, undefined retention policies, and potential CCPA violations
Extension integrates with external AI services (OpenAI, Claude) and loads dynamic content which could potentially execute remote code or be subject to supply chain attacks
Collection of device information, browser details, and behavioral patterns that could be used for user fingerprinting across websites and platforms
